WorkItem.ClosedComment: This bug has been fixed. If you're still seeing this issue, please re-open the bug (click "Re-open Issue" below the "ISSUES" tab). Thanks!
WorkItem.Description:
src/compiler/typecheck/__SemanticDiagnostic.ts__
  should be
src/compiler/typecheck/__semanticDiagnostic.ts__


Here is the pull request fixing it:

https://typescript.codeplex.com/SourceControl/network/forks/mihailik/CamelCasingForSemanticDiagnosticTS/contribution/4946
WorkItem.Summary: SemanticDiagnostic.ts needs to be in camelCase, breaks Linux build

Comments.Message: Thanks for pointing out.  We'll take a look at this.
One would think something breaking the build would be considered very high priority, no?

You may need to redo your pull request. It looks like they merged devel into their batchPerformance branch and your pull request is for the devel branch which no longer exists. Just bad timing I guess. Also, you need to do a git mv, not a delete and then add - your pull request would have broken the file history.

All the latest commits are on the develop branch. Also git mv is a macro for add/remove anyway. 

I wonder actually, whether we in the community should help Microsoft setting up a Linux build somewhere in Travis or whatever. Just in case Ryan Cavanaugh or Anders Hejlsberg need that extra help figuring out whom to fire in the next round of head cuts.
